Compares two error conditions. 

@1@ Checks whether {{c|lhs}} and {{c|rhs}} are equal.
@2@ Checks whether {{c|lhs}} and {{c|rhs}} are not equal.
@3@ Checks whether {{c|lhs}} is ''less than'' {{c|rhs}}.
@4@ Obtains three-way comparison result of {{c|lhs}} and {{c|rhs}}.
@5@ Checks whether {{c|code}} is a semantic match for {{c|cond}}.
@6@ Checks whether {{c|code}} is not a semantic match for {{c|cond}}.

{{rrev|since=c++20|1=
{{cpp/note synthesized compare}}
}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|lhs, rhs, cond|error conditions to compare}}
{{par|code|the error code to compare}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
@1@ {{c|true}} if the error category and error value compare equal.
@2@ {{c|true}} if the error category or error value compare are not equal.
@3@ {{c|true}} if {{c|lhs.category() &lt; rhs.category()}}. Otherwise, {{c|true}} if {{c|1=lhs.category() == rhs.category() &amp;&amp; lhs.value() &lt; rhs.value()}}. Otherwise, {{c|false}}.
@4@ {{c|1=lhs.category() &lt;=&gt; rhs.category()}} if it is not {{c|std::strong_ordering::equal}}. Otherwise, {{c|1=lhs.value() &lt;=&gt; rhs.value()}}.
@5@ {{c|true}} if either {{c|code.category().equivalent(code.value(), cond)}} or {{c|cond.category().equivalent(code, cond.value())}}.
@6@ {{c|true}} if neither {{c|code.category().equivalent(code.value(), cond)}} nor {{c|cond.category().equivalent(code, cond.value())}}.
